what: BLUF: Recommended JVM parameters for dssrip2
title: Java Virtual Machine Parameters
text: Adding following setting .Rprofile resolve JVM errors encountered using dssrip2: -Xmx refers JVM maximum heap size. set 8000 MB, depending requirements can set lower higher. general format -Xmx<Heap Size>[Unit], [unit] can k/K kilobytes, m/M megabytes, g/G gigabytes.

title: Java Virtual Machine Parameters
text: Like Java-dependent packages, performance dssrip2 dependent configuration Java Virtual Machine (JVM). JVM can configured different ways passing parameters control JVM initialized. JVM shared packages R session, generally good practice individual packages set JVM parameters parameters specified first loaded package applied. Instead, JVM parameters specified .Rprofile. JVM parameters can set using option java.parameters follows: Several resources describing JVM parameters available. complete list JVM parameters see Overview Java Options.

what: An abridged list of JVM parameters
title: Java Virtual Machine Parameters
text: list common JVM parameters affecting performance Java-dependent R packages: e.g., set maximum heap size 8000 MB: -Xmx8000M e.g., set minimum heap size 1000 MB: -Xms1000M Initial Young Generation Heap Size: -XX:NewSize=<young size>[Unit] Maximum Young Generation Heap Size: -XX:MaxNewSize=<young size>[Unit] Serial Garbage Collector: -XX:+UseSerialGC Parallel Garbage Collector: -XX:+UseParallelGC CMS Garbage Collector: XX:+USeParNewGC G1 Garbage Collector: XX:+USeG1GC Print Garbage Collection Details Messages: -XX:+PrintGCDetails Print Date Stamp GC Details Messages: -XX:+PrintGCDateStamps Redirect Garbage Collection Details Messages: -Xloggc:<filename> Helpful handling large log files. Default value 1, always >= 1. Log File Rotation Size: -XX:GCLogFileSize=<file size>[Unit] brief summary common JVM parameters, see Java Dev Journal article. information Java Garbage Collectors, see Java Dev Journal article.

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: dssrip2 uses rJava package, provides Java Virtual Machine (JVM) shared R packages session. default JVM parameters modest usually insufficient working larger DSS files. launching dssrip2 (R package uses rJava, JVM launched first package requires ) least set JVM total memory parameter. example, set JVM total memory 8000 MB: simplified startup, set options .Rprofile. information setting Java parameters, see Java Parameters vignette.

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: recommended method connecting DSS download HEC Monolith jar files, provides standalone access HEC DSS functionality without requiring installation HEC-DSSVue application. default, HEC Monolith installs APPDATA. simplified startup, can add following options .Rprofile:

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: Alternatively, HEC-DSSVue installed machine can call dss_connect() supply path DSSVue install folder: simplified startup, can add following options .Rprofile:
code: library(dssrip2)  dss_connect("C:/Program Files/HEC/HEC-DSSVue") options(dss.home = "C:/Program Files/HEC/HEC-DSSVue",   dss.monolith = FALSE)

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: dssrip2 provides example dataset: file contains five datasets: daily flow timeseries 15-minute stage timeseries annual peak flow irregular timeseries annual peak stage irregular timeseries flow-elevation paired datasets DSS catalog can read R using dss_catalog(): dss_catalog() supports regex pattern matching subset path list: dssrip2 also provides variety functions provided assist manipulating DSS paths: dssrip2 provides function dss_read() read DSS datasets R. output format automatically deduced DSS data type: DSS regular irregular time series converted two-column data frames. DSS paired datasets converted two-column () data frames. DSS grid data converted SpatRasters (see package:terra information).
code: exfile = system.file("extdata/example.dss", package = "dssrip2") dss_catalog(exfile, condensed = TRUE) #> [1] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"                    #> [2] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-ANNUAL PEAK/30Apr1947 - 30Oct2012/IR-CENTURY/USGS/"  #> [3] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/"                       #> [4] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/GAGE HEIGHT/31Aug2012 - 30Sep2012/15MIN/USGS/"            #> [5] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/STAGE-ANNUAL PEAK/01JAN1900 - 01JAN2000/IR-CENTURY/USGS/" dss_catalog(exfile, "/.*/.*/FLOW.*/.*/.*/.*/") #> [1] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"                   #> [2] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-ANNUAL PEAK/30Apr1947 - 30Oct2012/IR-CENTURY/USGS/" #> [3] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/" path = "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"  # split path into parts dss_parts_split(path) #>                  A              B    C                     D    E    F #> 1 BRANDYWINE CREEK WILMINGTON, DE FLOW 01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012 1DAY USGS  # replace path part dss_parts_replace(path, list(B = "WILMINGTON, DELAWARE")) #> [1] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DELAWARE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"  # combine parts into path dss_parts_combine(list(A = "BASIN", B = "LOCATION", C = "PARAMETER",   D = "", E = "1DAY", F = "EXAMPLE")) #> [1] "/BASIN/LOCATION/PARAMETER//1DAY/EXAMPLE/" # read in a regular timeseries dss_read(exfile, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW//1DAY/USGS/") #>     datetime flow #> 1 1946-10-02  235 #> 2 1946-10-03  220 #> 3 1946-10-04  210 #> 4 1946-10-05  200 #> 5 1946-10-06  195 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 24102 rows ]  # read in a single chunk of a regular timeseries dss_read(exfile, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01JAN1948/1DAY/USGS/",   full = FALSE) #>     datetime flow #> 1 1948-01-02  522 #> 2 1948-01-03 2780 #> 3 1948-01-04 1030 #> 4 1948-01-05  590 #> 5 1948-01-06  518 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 361 rows ]  # read in irregular timeseries dss_read(exfile, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-ANNUAL PEAK//IR-CENTURY/USGS/") #>     datetime flow-annual peak #> 1 1947-05-01             4730 #> 2 1948-09-11             5160 #> 3 1948-12-31             4940 #> 4 1950-08-04             4610 #> 5 1950-11-26            11500 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 62 rows ]  # read in a paired dataset dss_read(exfile, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/") #>   flow stage #> 1 2000  5.00 #> 2 3260  6.24 #> 3 3470  6.36 #> 4 3470  6.43 #> 5 3680  6.62 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 62 rows ]

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: dssrip2 Also provides write support time series paired data containers. reading data, dssrip2 determines appropriate DSS dataset type structure supplied input. good practice close DSS file finished working . part, dssrip2 call file’s $done() method completion every operation implicitly close file, can also explicitly close file: ’s !
code: outfile = tempfile(fileext = ".dss")  dss_create(outfile)  # create a regular timeseries from the LakeHuron dataset data(LakeHuron) lake_huron = data.frame(date = as.Date(sprintf("%d-10-01",   time(LakeHuron))), elev = as.vector(LakeHuron)) lake_huron_path = "/GREAT LAKES/LAKE HURON/ELEV//1YEAR/R DATASET/"  # additional attributes are required to write DSS data lake_huron = dss_add_attributes(lake_huron, list(units = "feet",   type = "INST"))  dss_write(lake_huron, outfile, lake_huron_path) #> Warning: Converting supplied timestamps to 'POSIXct' class, using default #> timezone Etc/GMT+0  # create an irregular timeseries from the airquality dataset data(airquality) aq = do.call(rbind, lapply(split(airquality, airquality$Month),   function(x)     x[which.max(x$Temp), ])) temps = data.frame(date = as.Date(sprintf("1973-%d-%d",   aq$Month, aq$Day)), temperature = aq$Temp) temps_path = "/NEW YORK/NEW YORK CITY/TEMPERATURE//IR-YEAR/R DATASET/"  # additional attributes temps = dss_add_attributes(temps, list(units = "degrees F",   type = "INST"))  dss_write(temps, outfile, temps_path) #> Warning: Converting supplied timestamps to 'POSIXct' class, using default #> timezone Etc/GMT+0  # create paired dataset from the Loblolly dataset data(Loblolly) growth = reshape(Loblolly, direction = "wide", idvar = "age", timevar = "Seed") names(growth) = gsub("height.", "seed_", names(growth)) growth_path = "//LOBLOLLY PINES/AGE-HEIGHT///R DATASET/"  # additional attributes growth = dss_add_attributes(growth, list(xunits = "years",   yunits = "feet", xtype = "UNT", ytype = "UNT"))  dss_write(growth, outfile, growth_path) dss_close(outfile)  # or close all open/implicitly closed files dss_close_all()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Michael Koohafkan. Author, maintainer. Evan Heisman. Author. Cameron Bracken. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Koohafkan M, Heisman E, Bracken C (2025). dssrip2: DSS R Interface Project (2). R package version 0.8-2, https://hydroecology.net/dssrip2/, https://github.com/mkoohafkan/dssrip2.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dssrip2: DSS R Interface Project (2)},   author = {Michael Koohafkan and Evan Heisman and Cameron Bracken},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.8-2,     https://hydroecology.net/dssrip2/},   url = {https://github.com/mkoohafkan/dssrip2}, }

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: rewrite dssrip. Supports reading writing time series paired data DSS. Read/write support DSS grid data planned. Supported Operating Systems: - Windows - Linux - MacOS Supported HEC-DSSVue versions: - HEC-DSSVue 2.0.1

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: can install dssrip2 directly using build vignettes install, use argument build_vignettes = TRUE.

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 can connect HEC-Monolith libraries using option dss.monolith set TRUE, dssrip2 interpret dss.home option HEC-Monolith directory path. default, dssrip2 install HEC-Monolith %LOCALAPPDATA% (Windows) ~/.dssrip2/monolith (Unix), can overridden. dss_connect() retrieve path using getOption("dss.home") path provided. use Monolith automatically, set following options R profile:

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: don’t want use HEC-Monolith libraries, dssrip2 can connect existing HEC-DSSVue program installation instead. use option, 64-bit install HEC-DSSVue 64-bit JDK required. load DSS functionality, call option dss.monolith set FALSE (default), dssrip2 interpret dss.home option HEC-DSSVue application directory path. use HEC-DSSVue installation automatically, set following option R profile:
code: library(dssrip2) dss_connect("path/to/HEC-DSSVue") options(   # replace with the install path on your machine   dss.home = "C:/Program Files/HEC/HEC-DSSVue" )

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: suppress messages DSS, use message level provided, dss_message_level() retrieve level using getOption("dss.messagelevel"). can also set option .Rprofile:
code: dss_connect(message_level = 1L)  # or after calling dss_connect() dss_message_level(1L) options(   dss.messagelevel = 1L )

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 can create DSS version 6 7 files: dssrip2 also provides methods convert DSS versions:
code: tf1 = tempfile(fileext = ".dss") tf2 = tempfile(fileext = ".dss")  # create a DSS-7 file (default behavior) dss_create(tf1) # create a DSS-6 file dss_create(tf2, version = 6) tf3 = tempfile(fileext = ".dss") dss_convert(tf2, tf3)

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 automatically detects data type read, function call can used reading time series paired data. DSS files usually close period inactivity, best practice users explicitly close file finished:
code: exfile = system.file("extdata/example.dss", package = "dssrip2")  # time series dss_read(exfile, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01JAN1946/1DAY/USGS/")  # paired data dss_read(exfile, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/") dss_close(exfile) # or close all files opened by dssrip2 with dss_close_all()

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 deduces data type write based supplied R object, function call can used reading time series paired data. However, writing DSS objects requires additional attributes must explicitly supplied user:
code: tf = tempfile(fileext = ".dss") dss_create(tf)  # time series data(Nile) nile = data.frame(datetime = as.Date(sprintf("%d-10-01", time(Nile))),   flow = as.vector(Nile) * 1e8) nile = dss_add_attributes(nile, list(units = "cubic meters",   type = "PER-CUM")) path = "//NILE RIVER/VOLUME//1YEAR/R DATASET/" dss_write(nile, tf, path)  # paired data data(CO2) uptake = reshape(CO2[c("Plant", "conc", "uptake")],   direction = "wide", idvar = "conc", timevar = "Plant") names(uptake) = gsub("uptake.", "", names(uptake)) uptake = dss_add_attributes(uptake, list(xtype = "LINEAR",   ytype = "LINEAR", xunits = "mL/L", yunits = "umol/m^2")) path = "//PLANT CO2 UPTAKE/CONCENTRATION-UPTAKE///R DATASET/" dss_write(uptake, tf, path)

title: POSIXct to HecTime — as_hectime
text: Convert R POSIXct datetime Java HecTime.

title: POSIXct to HecTime — as_hectime
text: x POSIXct timestamp. granularity minimum time interval. Can "secs" "mins". as_period TRUE, adjust timestamp represent period, timestamp specifying period end time (0100 2400 hours).

title: POSIXct to HecTime — as_hectime
text: Java hec.heclib.util.HecTime object.

title: DSS File Store — .file_store
text: dssrip2 file store. manages Java DSS File objects.

title: DSS File Store — .file_store
text: file store stores list hec.heclib.dss.HecDss Java object references named according normalized file path originating DSS file. file store provides four methods: get(): Retrieve DSS file handle store. set(): Create DSS file handle add store. drop(): Remove DSS file handle store. list(): List DSS file handle names store. set() method fails message javaHeclib.dll found, usually indicates dss.home set correctly.

title: DSS Assertions — dss-assertions
text: Helper functions DSS type format checking.

title: DSS Assertions — dss-assertions
code: assert_dss_connected()  assert_dss_file(file)  assert_path_format(path)  assert_parts_format(parts)  assert_read_support(obj)  assert_write_support(obj)  assert_timeseries(obj)  assert_timeseries_type(type)  assert_timeseries_interval(type)  assert_paired(obj)  assert_grid(obj)  assert_attributes(obj, attributes)

title: DSS Assertions — dss-assertions
text: assert_dss_connected(): Assert DSS dependencies loaded. assert_dss_file(): Assert supplied object DSS file handle. assert_path_format(): Assert supplied path correct format. assert_parts_format(): Assert set supplied parts named complete. assert_read_support(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS timeseries. assert_write_support(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS timeseries. assert_timeseries(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS timeseries. assert_timeseries_type(): Assert supplied time series type recognized. assert_timeseries_interval(): Assert supplied time series interval recognized. assert_paired(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS paired data container. assert_grid(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS grid data container. assert_attributes(): Assert supplied attributes match requirements supplied rJava object.

title: DSS Attributes — dss_attributes
text: Get set DSS attributes.

title: DSS Attributes — dss_attributes
text: x R object. attributes_list named list DSS attributes.

title: DSS Attributes — dss_attributes
text: object x, additional attribute "dss_attributes".

text: Get list DSS paths file.

code: dss_catalog(filename, pattern = ".*", condensed = TRUE, rebuild = FALSE)

title: Get DSS Paths — dss_catalog
text: filename DSS file path. pattern character string containing regular expression matched DSS pathname catalog. condensed TRUE returned condensed path catalog. rebuild TRUE, force rebuild catalog.

title: Get DSS Paths — dss_catalog
text: vector paths.

title: Get DSS Paths — dss_catalog
text: working large DSS files, may need initialize Java Virtual Machine (JVM) larger heap size. information see help vignette: vignette("Java Virtual Machine Parameters", package = "dssrip2")

title: Close DSS File — dss_close
text: Close DSS file. used user finished working DSS file, strictly required package implictly close DSS file every operation.

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
text: Connect DSS via JVM.

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
code: dss_require(   dss_home = getOption("dss.home"),   message_level = getOption("dss.messagelevel"),   monolith = getOption("dss.monolith"),   quietly = TRUE )  dss_connect(   dss_home = getOption("dss.home"),   message_level = getOption("dss.messagelevel"),   monolith = getOption("dss.monolith"),   quietly = FALSE )

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
text: dss_home path HEC-DSS install folder. message_level integer specifying DSS message level. Default 2L. Use 1L suppress messages DSS. monolith TRUE, connect HEC-Monolith libraries. quietly TRUE, suppress warnings regarding JVM.

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
text: dss_connect() dss_require() configure JVM use HEC-DSS Java library. dss_require() designed use inside packages; returns FALSE gives warning (rather error dss_connect() ) HEC-DSS Java library loaded correctly.

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
text: working large DSS files, may need initialize Java Virtual Machine (JVM) larger heap size. information see help vignette: vignette("Java Virtual Machine Parameters", package = "dssrip2")

title: Normalize DSS File Path — normalize_path
text: function attempts strictly resolve file paths traversing file path back deepest existing directory, order resolve potential issues directory names (e.g., differences letter case).

title: dssrip2 0.8-0
text: Added Linux support (tested Ubuntu 22.04). dss_require() now silent (always supposed ). Fixed bug writing tibble objects DSS.

title: dssrip2 0.7-1
text: dss_connect() now issues warning JVM limited memory resources.

title: dssrip2 0.7-0
text: Revamped apporach file handling. DSS files now handled internally byt package users longer need explicitly open close DSS files. New funciton dss_convert() convert DSS-6 DSS-7 files.
